title: Were Frank Sinatra or Elvis Presley popular in Russia? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the time when Elvis was on the top of his popularity, western music was banned in the USSR “as music that interfered with the building of Communism”. Same was with Frank Sinatra’s songs. Soviet Government thought that western songs have a bad influence to Soviet citizens but illegally all popular songs from West permeated despite “Iron Curtain”. All Western songs has been permitted offically during Perestroika times(end of 80s). Here legally released not pirated disc of Elvis songs from recording company “Melodiya/Мелодия”, Soviet legal publisher of foreign music. Nowadays in Russia has big fan club of Elvis and communities in Social networks. I hope that my answer useful for you :) P.S. My favourite album of remix songs of Elvis Elvis Isn't Dead - 12 Tracks Remodelled For The Nineties
